english_translation: Narrated by the Prophet ﷺ: The upper hand is better than the lower hand, and begin with those you maintain.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith (cut/disconnected) with no chain of narrators connecting it to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Maqtu' hadith with complete chain disconnection
potential_issues.impact: Without a complete chain of narrators connecting this hadith to the Prophet ﷺ, its authenticity cannot be established through isnad analysis. The hadith is isolated from any transmission chain.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by the Prophet ﷺ: While I was sleeping, I was given some treasures from the treasures of the earth. Two bracelets of gold were placed on my hands, which concerned and worried me. Then it was revealed to me to blow on them. So I blew on them and they disappeared. I interpreted them as the two liars between whom I am: the one from Sana'a and the one from Yamama.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith with no chain of narrators connecting it to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.impact: The hadith lacks any chain of transmission. The matn discusses the Prophet's ﷺ interpretation of a dream regarding two false prophets, but without narrators, the authenticity of this attribution cannot be verified.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Dream interpretation by the Prophet ﷺ
Incident of the false prophets from Sana'a and Yamama

english_translation: Narrated by the Prophet ﷺ: None of you will be saved by his deeds. They asked: Not even you, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Not even me, except that Allah encompasses me with His mercy and favor.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith with no chain of narrators connecting it to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.impact: This hadith contains an important theological teaching about reliance on Allah's mercy rather than deeds alone. However, without a proper chain of transmission, its attribution to the Prophet ﷺ cannot be verified through isnad analysis.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Reliance on Allah's mercy over deeds
Dialogue between companions and the Prophet ﷺ

english_translation: He said: The Prophet ﷺ prohibited two transactions and two garments. One is that someone should not sit covered with a single garment with nothing covering his genitals, and one is that he should not wrap himself in his izaar (lower garment) when praying unless he brings the two ends together over his shoulder.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith with no chain of narrators connecting it to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.impact: The hadith discusses prohibition of certain garment wearing styles during prayer and covering the genitals. Without a chain of transmission, the authenticity of this prohibition cannot be verified.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Method of wearing the izaar during prayer

english_translation: Narrated by the Prophet ﷺ: He prohibited al-lams (touching), al-ilqa' (throwing), and al-najsh (deceptive bidding).

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith with no chain of narrators connecting it to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Maqtu' hadith with no chain of transmission
potential_issues.impact: This hadith discusses prohibitions related to trade practices (al-lams, al-ilqa', al-najsh). Without a complete chain of narrators, its authenticity cannot be verified through isnad analysis.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by the Prophet ﷺ: The dumb animal incurs no compensation if she causes injury, the well incurs no compensation, the mine incurs no compensation, fire incurs no compensation, and in buried treasure is the fifth part.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith with no chain of narrators connecting it to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.impact: This hadith discusses important legal principles related to compensation and the distribution of buried treasure. Without a proper chain of transmission, these rulings cannot be verified as authentic attributions to the Prophet ﷺ.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by the Prophet ﷺ: Whatever village you came to and settled in, your share of the spoils is for you.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a maqtu' hadith with no chain of narrators

potential_issues.issue: Disconnected hadith with no chain of transmission
potential_issues.impact: Without a proper chain of narrators, the authenticity of this ruling about spoils distribution cannot be verified.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Distribution of spoils from conquered territories

author_name_ar: أبو نعيم أحمد بن عبد الله الإصبهاني
author_name_en: Abu Nu'aim Ahmad ibn Abdullah al-Isfahani
english_translation: This is the introduction to the Musnad (Collection) of Abu Hanifah by al-Hafiz Abu Nu'aim al-Isfahani. The compiler states: Regarding what has reached us of the collections of traditions of Imam Abu Hanifah al-Nu'man ibn al-Thabit, the jurist of the people of Kufa.

narrators.name: Abu Nu'aim al-Isfahani
narrators.full_name: Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Ahmad ibn Ishaq al-Isfahani
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Nu'aim, al-Hafiz al-Isfahani

chainIssues: This entry is a collection introduction, not a hadith with a transmission chain

potential_issues.issue: Not a hadith but a collection introduction
potential_issues.impact: This is editorial commentary about the collection, not an actual hadith transmission.

Topics: Introduction to the Musnad of Abu Hanifah

english_translation: Narrated by Ibrahim ibn Abdullah: Muhammad ibn Ishaq al-Thaqafi narrated to us, as did al-Jawhari, as did Abu Nu'aim. He said: Abu Hanifah was a person of deep diving into juridical issues.

narrators.name: Ibrahim ibn Abdullah
narrators.alternative_names: Ibrahim ibn Abdullah

chainIssues: This is biographical information about Abu Hanifah, not a hadith from the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.impact: This is information about the jurisprudential imam Abu Hanifah's scholarly methodology, not a hadith transmission.
The exact identities of the narrators are not specified, making verification difficult.

Topics: Biographical information about Imam Abu Hanifah

english_translation: Narrated through chain to al-A'mash: He said...

narrators.name: Ibrahim ibn Muhammad ibn Malik ibn Zubaid
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Muhammad ibn Malik ibn Zubaid
narrators.alternative_names: Ibrahim ibn Muhammad al-Zubaid

narrators.name: Ali ibn Qarun ibn Bahis
narrators.alternative_names: Ali ibn Qarun

narrators.name: Dawood ibn al-Muhabbar
narrators.full_name: Dawood ibn al-Muhabbar ibn Qahdhah ibn Sulaiman ibn Dhikwan
narrators.alternative_names: Dawood ibn al-Muhabbar al-Dhahhak

narrators.name: Sabrah ibn Mu'abbad
narrators.full_name: Sabrah ibn Mu'abbad ibn Awsajah ibn Harmalah ibn Sabrah ibn Khadij
narrators.alternative_names: Sabrah al-Juhani

chainIssues: First narrator Ibrahim is majhul (unknown)
Second narrator Ali ibn Qarun is majhul (unknown)
Third narrator Dawood ibn al-Muhabbar is Saduq Lahu Awham (reliable but has occasional errors)
Use of عَنْ (from) by narrators who may not be established to have met the next narrator

potential_issues.issue: Two unknown narrators at the beginning of the chain
potential_issues.impact: Ibrahim ibn Muhammad ibn Malik and Ali ibn Qarun are both majhul (unknown) narrators, which significantly weakens the chain's reliability.

potential_issues.issue: Dawood ibn al-Muhabbar has occasional reporting errors
potential_issues.impact: While Dawood is generally considered reliable, he is known to have Awham (occasional confusions), which affects the chain's overall strength.

potential_issues.issue: Ambiguous transmission terms in the chain
potential_issues.impact: The use of عَنْ (from) creates ambiguity about direct transmission, especially given the unknown status of earlier narrators.

english_translation: Section header: Mention of those from the companions who saw and narrated from them.

narrators.name: Compiler
narrators.alternative_names: Collection Editor

chainIssues: This is a section header, not a hadith

potential_issues.issue: Not a hadith but a collection section header
potential_issues.impact: This is editorial organizational text, not a hadith transmission or statement.

Topics: Section on companions who transmitted hadith

english_translation: Anas ibn Malik and Abdullah ibn al-Harith ibn Juzz al-Zubaidī, and it is said: Abdullah ibn Abi Awfi al-Aslami, may Allah be pleased with them. The scholars differed regarding the death of Anas ibn Malik. Some said he died in year 90 AH, others said 93 AH, and others said 94 AH.
